channel.title: How do you write logs?
channel.description:
I wanna know how people create logs so I can perfect mine.
(No class in particular)
My Glossary -
NR - (all support and knight claims will have this if nothing important to return) Not Required
ORI - Occupation and Redirection Immune.
XRY - (X - target 1, Y - Target 2) targeted X initially redirected to Y
Locked - Occupied
Prince's - Visit jailed target
IV - investigate
SC - Scout
SoSu - Social Support
KiOf - Killer Offensive
SpIv - Special Investigative

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
the obs got standardized to 3, 4 > 10 > x and now nobody seems able to read any other format

not even me

the same clearly needs to happen with maid because they are writing matches in different orders and getting misunderstood

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
Yeah, but we don’t have a 100% standardized log, because everyone writes his logs a bit different, and that’s fine. There’s not the one right solution.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
if maid logs were standardized like obs logs are there would be no confusion

and no wasted space

n1 match 2|4|match
n2 match 4|3|incompatible

it’s obvious that 2 is starting match, because it’s the starting number

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
Writing down the starting target of the Maid is important it helps a lot avoiding confusion

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
explicitly identifying the starting or latest maid match is unnecessary and a waste of space

it should be clear from the rest of the logs what the starting match was (e.g. the first player listed N1)

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
But yeah, Marshal wrote a lot of the common abbrevations down. Basically, every abbrevation which gets used by a lot of people is understandable.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: Marshal
item.description:
I mean most of your logs are easy to understand with context, (like a princess claim with spiv in it’s logs) But a lot of it is things i’ve never seen

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: SabreOverdrive
item.description:
Yikes. Priestess wouldn’t know mine then

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
I use none of these abbrevations, Jake, and wouldn’t understand them when I see them ingame O_o

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
You might want to check out this guide. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1702884901

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: Marshal
item.description:
Marshal | Class(usually a play on words)

N# | action #[RD #] | Result
[Day action][Result]
N# | action #[RD #] | Result

Example
Marshal | Physkitchen

N1 | Heal 1 | DNR
[Innoc 3]
N2 | Heal 3[RD 5] | Healed!

Princess results:
K/O
S/I
S/S

Phys:
DNR
Healed
Bleed Healed

Chrono:
PD(pocket dimension)
TW(timewarp)
Delayed!
DND

CW:
Emp(empower)
Aided
Not aided

Sherrif/Pala:
Inv(investigate)
TF(test faith)
Surv(surveille)

Maid:
MM(matchmake)
match!
Inco!

Drunk:
HH(happy hour)
Deb #>#

Obs:
Visitors>Target>visited

Occ/red imm:
Imm or Fail

Target jailed:

Jailed
Imprisoned
Prince’d

Read full topic

item.title: How do you write logs?
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
Name - Prince

N1 - Jail # (Claim)
N2 - Jail # (Claim)

Name - Maid
Starting: #

N1 - MM [(Starting #)] - (Matching #) (Match!/Incompat)
N2 - MM [(Last #)] - (Matching #) (Match!/Incompat)
(In the case of a N# occupation)
N2 - MM [(Last # here)] - (Matching #) (Match!/Incompat)

I did 2 logs. Any questions?

Read full topic

item.description:
I wanna know how people create logs so I can perfect mine.

(No class in particular)

My Glossary -

NR - (all support and knight claims will have this if nothing important to return) Not Required
